flatVocabParam.name: organism
flatVocabParam.help: Choose an organism to run the enrichment analysis on. To see all organisms, select 'All results' filter above. (Only organisms with enrichment results are shown here).

flatVocabParam.name: goAssociationsOntologies
flatVocabParam.help: Choose the Ontology that you are interested in analyzing. Only terms from this ontology will be considered during the enrichment analysis. The ontologies are three structured, controlled vocabularies that describe gene products in terms of their related biological processes, cellular components and molecular functions. For statistical reasons, only one ontology may be analyzed at once. If you are interested in more than one, run separate GO enrichment analyses.

enumParam.name: goEvidenceCodes
enumParam.help: A GO Evidence Code of IEA is assigned to a computationally assigned association.All others have some degree of curation

enumParam.name: goSubset
enumParam.help: Choose Yes to limit enrichment analysis based on terms that are in the GO Slim generic subset. This will limit both the background and the gene list of interest.

enumParam.name: thresholdTypeParam
enumParam.help: This statistic will be calculated when comparing your result set to each gene list. Only comparisons which meet the cutoff value will be returned

numberParam.name: thresholdParam
numberParam.help: Only comparisons with values which meet this cutoff will be returned

enumParam.name: useOrthologyParam
enumParam.help: Should we extend the search to consider genes orthologous to ones in the input list?

enumParam.name: datasetCutoffTypeParam
enumParam.help: This statistic will be used as a cutoff when creating gene lists. Currently gene lists an be created by either taking the top genes above a fold change cutoff or by taking the top genes Ranked by fold change.

enumParam.name: enrichmentTypeParam
enumParam.help: Choose what enrichment type you would like to analyze

flatVocabParam.name: datasetSelectionParam
flatVocabParam.help: Crurated Gene Lists you have imported into your workspace, and that is installed in @PROJECT_ID@

numberParam.name: datasetCutoffParam
numberParam.help: This number is used as a cutoff when creating gene lists to search

sqlQuery.name: organismsInAnswer
sqlQuery.sql: select organism as term, organism as display, organism as internal from (SELECT distinct ga.organism FROM webready.GeneAttributes_p ga, ($$answerIdSql$$) r where ga.source_id = r.gene_source_id and ga.gene_type in ('protein coding gene','pseudogene') order by ga.organism asc) q

sqlQuery.name: ontologiesInAnswer
geneListUserDataset
